name: BEST WESTERN Lake Buena Vista Resort Hotel

reviews.title: HAD THE BEST TIME
reviews.text: Just stayed with my family at your hotel for 6 days, we had the best time. Your staff was very helpful and kind. Ozzy the bellman was great helping us get around, so was the front desk staff, bartenders, etc..Everyone was great. The room was very clean and comfortable. Will be back again later this year.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Place Downtown Disney
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Best Western for an anniversary gift for my son and Daughter in law

reviews.title: Great value; good stay; 3rd yr
reviews.text: They called to tell me that their room, King with Balcony, was gorgeous and the view was

reviews.title: Donna T
reviews.text: awesome.

reviews.title: So much comfort! Execellent Location
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and couteous and the housekeeing staff superb.
stayed here for the last 10 years so its like home from home staff really friendly
reviews.title: quality and excellent location
Dirtiest Best Western ever!
reviews.text: My husband and I travel frequently and stay in Best Westerns. This is the 2nd dirtiest hotel we've ever stayed at in our life, and we've been all over Mexico and the USA. There was a dark red stain on the bedding, everything that wasn't a countertop was covered in a thick coat of dirt and grime. The air vents were completely covered in grime- the vent in the shower is now clean because I wiped it off and my hand turned black from the dirt.
The baseboards and switch plates for lights were filthy.
reviews.title: Not really a Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping does not clean anything. The walls had stains and have not been cleaned or wiped off in years. To sum it up, FIRE all the housekeepers and hire people who acutally work.
reviews.title: Great value for a Disney Vacation

reviews.text: Security= lacking. Upon entering our room we found a leaflet from the hotel saying to order pizza only from the Pizza Hut in the lobby. The hotel was unable to keep people from the local pizza places from sliding flyers under the room doors. During the evening we had THREE flyers from pizza delivery places slid under our door. Obviously their hotel security is failing for this to occur.
reviews.title: Don't get riped off!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given our trip so hotel was included. I didn't feel the front desk person was very friendly when we checked in, however everyone else was. I didn't appreciate being shuffled off to "guest services" right away which turned out to be a timeshare pitch. Buses were always on time with mostly very friendly drivers. I also didn't appreciate the gratuity automatically added in to my dining bill, I tip when and if the service deserves it and don't like being forced to. I feel it is not my fault if they don't pay their workers enough, I also work hard for my wages and do not receive tips! Location was good, hotel was quiet and clean.
reviews.title: Our stay was part of a gift..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here in the beginning of January. We chose this hotel because we were able to use our Best Western Rewards points to get the room free while we visited Disney World after a 7 day caribbean cruise. We were thankful to get the room for free, and we did not spend very much time in the room, but I would never have paid to stay there. The hotel is not up to the usual Best Western standards. Our room was not very clean. The carpet and bedding were very old.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for...or not

reviews.text: Most Best Western hotels include a free continental breakfast, but this one did not. The first morning of our stay we paid for the breakfast buffet in the coffee shop on premises, but it wasn't very good. The next morning we had breakfast at Disneyworld. It was worth the higher price.
reviews.title: DON'T STAY HERE, PRICED OK ROOMS OLD DIRTY RUDE RUDE RUDE

reviews.text: If we ever make it back to Disneyworld, we will for sure pay to stay at a hotel on the Disneyworld property. We are used to nicer, cleaner places. You get what you pay for I guess.
reviews.title: Expect to call front desk when arriving in room

reviews.text: Please Stay Far Away From This Hotel, We Stayed For4 Nights FIRST We Checked IN and they did not have the room that we requested. The hotel clerk had a Rollaway Bed brought up because there was not enough room for our entire family we had 5 ppl, red flag!!! Requested a deluxe room and got a shabby old room with stains everywhere!NOBODY cleaned room. WE CALLED 4 TIMES FOR TOWELS nobody came. The next day I called and the front desk clerk said no manager was on duty SO CALL BACK SO I TOLD HER THE SITUATION and she said she would make sure the room go the whole V.I.P. TREATMENT...HA HA THAT MEANS CLEAN SHEETS I called and left a message on this so called manager Mike's voicemail and he called me a liar that I CALLED HIM AT ALL. WHAT A JOKE!!! SO ANYWAY LONG STORY SHORT THIS HOTEL SUCKED AND DO NOT TAKE YOUR CHILDREN HERE They will catch something and you will be very disappointed!!!! Watch out for valet parking they will try to get you to do valet parking for 1/2 the price when the parking lot is right there anyway....don't do it!!!!!!ALREADY PAID THE RESORT FEE WHICH IS 9.00 A DAY FOR PARKING ANYWAY. The restraunt was ok diner food but don't even think about asking any questions to the lady in the giftshop she is THE RUDEST TOO I ASKED HER HOW SHE WAS AND SHE DID NOT EVEN LOOK AT ME. She was not helpful and had no answers about disney TICKETS....BEWARE OF TIMESHARE SALES IN THE LOBBY ALSO. THEY WILL TRY AND SELL YOU A TIMESHARE. I THINK THE OWNERS ARE TOTALLY NOT AWARE AND DO NOT CARE ABOUT THIER CUSTOMERS.....TAK MY ADVICE DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! YOU WILL DEFINATELY THANK ME IN THE END!!!!!!! IF I COULD GIVE A LOWER REVIEW I WOULD FOR THE SELECTIONS FOR SERVICE VALUE ETC. IT IS A DUMP AND YOU CAN STAY SOMEWHERE BETTER....RUDE, DIRTY AND DISCUSTING ATTITUDES!!!! MOLD GROWING IN BATHROOMS AND T.V. DOESN'T WORK.......OH YES ONE MORE THING THE MANAGER *NEVER*CAME OUT UNTIL I MENTIONED I WAS GOING TO CONTACT THE GENERAL MANAGER..THEN HE SAID IS THERE A PROBLEM HERE? Yes there is and he said what do you want me to do???? I said we will never stay here agian and he said ooooookkkkkkkkkkkkk......that is fine...so he argued with me in front of a whole line of customers.....no customer service skills whatsoever!!! Warning too they add gratuity to everything so BEWARE!!!!!
reviews.title: Poor for Best Western

reviews.text: As we'd never been to the Orlando area before we weren't sure which area to choose,
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel online through www.bookit.com & paid $371.46 for 5 nights. Immediately after booking I emailed the hotel requesting a room on the highest floor away from the elevator, ice machine & other common areas with a king bed. I also requested a Disney view (you can see the fireworks @ night). Upon check-in we received all as requested.
reviews.title: Good price, good location.

reviews.text: This hotel is in the Downtown Disney area & only a 7 minute walk to the Disney Marketplace. It's also a short walk to the grocery store, McDonalds, Red Lobster & other amenities.
reviews.title: OK for the price, great location

reviews.text: The hotel has a pool but no hot tub. The restaurant/lounge has limited food selection but the chicken burger was great! Free Disney shuttle is available.
reviews.title: Good location but needs refurbishing

reviews.text: We spent a couple of days at Lake Buena Vista, did Epcot and Downtown Disney,had a great time. Hotel, first impression, looks good, but upon further review, as they say in the NFL, definetly needs to be updated. Bathroom door has to be changed, paint peeling off the door, water stains on ceiling and wall, paint job did not do it, large tear on the inside of the drapes. Room was large, had a great view on the 17th floor, free shuttle from hotel to parks and back, very convenient. Will definetly try another hotel next trip.
reviews.title: Best Western Lake Buena Vista

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. Two of the lights in the room did not work at all. The one above the night stand kept flickering. The sofa bed was old and worn. We didn't use it as a bed, but when you sat on it, it sank in terribly. We had 4 people, but were only left 3 bath towels, that were very old and thin. The last night of our stay we were only left 2 bath towels, I mean really we used all they were all dirty. They were not all replaced. Than the last morning we were there, construction was going on in a room at 8am. It was terrible. We will never stay there again.
reviews.title: Needs updating!!!

reviews.text: This property if one of the Disney Hotels and it was dirty and needed updating. We had to change our DIRTY sheets at 11:00pm our 1st night. Nothing like a day at Disney then you want to get a nice shower and get in to a clean bed and there is hair everywhere. Front desk staff did not care one bit. Housekeeping handed me a clean set of sheets that didn't even match and didn't bother to bring pillowcases, that was a 2nd call. Also, room didn't have a fridge. Every other hotel now days has them. Laundry area had such an odor because someone stuffed dirty diapers in it. I told housekeeping and the guy just said ok and did nothing. Carpets in the hallway could have used a vacuum. Needed help with airline boarding passes and the front desk just pushed me off and said go over there. Poor customer service.
reviews.title: Dirty and needs updating

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at this hotel a few weeks ago. From the front desk staff, to the restaurant/bar staff, we were ALWAYS greeted with a smile and felt welcomed! We loved that staff was happy, outgoing and engaging! During our stay, we had lost 2 memory cards somewhere in Animal Kingdom. We mentioned it to staff at breakfast the following morning, and they couldn't have been more sympathetic, accommodating and helpful. Staff went out of their way to offer suggestions and provide us with lost and found contacts. Thankfully, we were able to locate our cards! Our room was good size, clean, very comfortable and our view of Disney was definitely a plus, we especially enjoyed watching the fireworks from our balcony! There is plenty of parking and the lot is well lit. They also offer valet parking. Without a doubt, we recommend this hotel, and will stay again in the future!. Special thanks to Mike, Anita, Kathy, and Jussye for helping to make my husband's first visit to Disney extra special!
reviews.title: Welcoming staff, clean and comfortable rooms!

reviews.text: Stayed here with family, it was an average hotel. You get what you pay for. The staff was great. They were very friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Average - Pros and Cons

reviews.text: Pros: Good price, very reliable disney shuttle, nice staff, safe location
reviews.title: BW Lake Buena Vista

reviews.text: I won this hotel via Hotwire for under $50/night. Large, comfortable and very clean room. Bedding was good and bathroom was large. There is a small vanity outside the shower/sink area which would help two people get ready at once. Cable TV offering was poor. Pool was nice and dining room/bar was okay - they automatically added the tip to my bill so pay attention.
reviews.title: Good hotel - nice location

reviews.text: Not disclosed until check-in was an $8/day resort fee that covers the busses to the parks, parking, and internet.
reviews.title: Fiasco.

reviews.text: Location was convenient to Downtown Disney, my meeting locations, and there are numerous chain dining options within a few blocks.
reviews.title: Worst hotel experience I have ever had.

reviews.text: After a long, sleepless day of traveling beginning at 2am the day before, we arrive at the Best Western-Lake Buena Vista. While waiting in line for what seemed to be FOREVER, we heard one customer complaining that she and her family were checked into a room that was dirty and had not been cleaned! (YUCK!). Finally it was our turn. We got charged an extra hidden fee of $9 a night per room for their "resort fee". We took our stuff up to the rooms and left for dinner & Disney parks. The rooms have absolutely NO extras- No microwave, fridge, anything. (This is 2010, people, keep up with the times..) When we returned a little after midnight the room was hot and stuffy. The air conditioner wasn't working. We had to leave the balcony door open. The next day while trying to blow-dry my hair the plug would not stay in ANY of the outlets, it fell right out. I had to hold it in with my brush while drying my hair. We were gone all day and night and once again came back to a hot and stuffy room. The next day, after taking a luke warm-cold shower, I was blow-drying my hair.. the breaker shut off. I had to go into family's room next to us to finish.. The breaker went off in there after about 4 minutes. We left for the whole day. When we got back for the night we decided to go to the hotel dining room and eat dinner. It was 9:30, the kitchen didn't close until 10:00. After being ignored for 10 minutes, the waitress came to take our order.. "What can I get you to eat, I need to hurry the Kitchen closes soon..." We disregarded her rudeness and ordered our food. Trying to be polite to her "needing to hurry", my husband decided to order dessert with our meal. "We dont really have a dessert menu, we have ice cream.." as she walked away. We asked a different waitress and she listed all sorts of desserts they had. Our waitress was then mad and slamming things around. My husband and I went to the front desk, told the "supervisor" the issue and she wasn't really helpful or concerned. We then left and walked to Friday's and ate there. Coming back to the hotel around 1230am, our key was deactivated. (This same thing happened in my sister's room the next day.) I really recommend NOT choosing this hotel. Customer service is awful. Lots of hidden fees with NO extras. Air conditioning didn't work along with Hot water, outlets, power breaker went on and off. And cable TV going in and out as well.
reviews.title: Great Holiday Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Made reservations here for 5 nights but only stayed for two. Checked in on Sunday afternoon after a long road trip and put our bags in the room and went to downtown Disney for dinner and sight seeing. Got back to hotel and did not have sheets on couch bed which we upgraded to and was paying extra for. Did not get sheets until 45 minutes latter at 11:30pm and my wife was talked to rudely by front desk when she called to ask why it was taking so long. The first night the ac did not work and was very noisy. The toilet did not flush very well so we had to leave house keeping a little surprise. Luckily that was cleaned up when we got back the second night. We also had a problem with the lamps turning on and off when you walked by them and the balcony door got stuck. Luckily no one was on the balcony when it got stuck. The front desk was rude with my wife again when she called back the second day so I got on the phone and told them we would be checking out . I asked to speak with a manager about getting a discount due to our inconvenience but we where told that the manager was unavailable and would call us latter. We never received a call. I did not go back or call to see about the refund since we where here to enjoy ourselves and not to be having to deal with all of these problems. We checked into the Doubletree Suites across the street and had way more spacious and updated rooms, the staff was excellent, microwave and fridge where included all for just $10.00 a night more. Did I mention a great pool and jacuzzi and all the choclate chip cookies you want. Skip the trouble and frustration of the Best Western Buena Vista Resort and go across the street to the Doubletree.
reviews.title: Lots of Extra Costs

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. Buses to Disney parks were a plus, all the staff were friendly and helpful, some of the employees at the front desk could learn to wear a smile when you just arrive after a long trip nothing is nicer and says more for your Hotel than to be greated with a smile. Everyone one else was great. All of the wait staff were so nice that I miss them all. It was so nice getting up in the morning and going down to have breakfast with everyone. They were great a plus. The bar was great too. Sitting by the pool with my drink how relaxing then I came home, back to reality. Great people nice Hotel I will be back Thanks for adding to our vacation Linda
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel ,great value

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for one week in February-March 2010 to visit the Disney parks. The biggest plus is the shuttle service to the parks. There are two buses, each servicing two of the parks. One goes to Epcot and Animal Kingdom. The other Magic Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. The buses run on Route B, which also services two other hotels. Buses run every 30 minutes and this hotel is the first pick up point on the way to the parks and usually the first drop off on the way back. This is important if you don't like standing. Only the Disney resorts themselves have better bus service.
reviews.title: Good for the value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean but a little dated, as others have mentioned. Nothing fancy. We did not use the pool or any other amenities, only slept there. There are several restaurants and fast food places within a 2 minute drive in and around the Crossroads Shopping Center.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Comfortable but.... Unexpected $20 charge

reviews.text: The only downside was that the front desk staff did not seem very happy to be working there and were not very friendly. When comparing this to other hotels it is best to add the $8 per day service charge to the total.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and hotel was beautiful and comfortable. The location was convenient and the bar was great; however, a day after checkout, an unexpected, unexplained $20 charge was charged to my card.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: I was in Orlando for a meeting at another hotel, overpriced, and, since I've had generally good luck with Best Western in the past, chose this hotel. Booked it through Expedia which seemed like a pretty good deal. Remember the old adage, "If it appears too good to be true...".
reviews.title: A good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived and checked in. Upon check-in, found that a $10/night "resort fee" would be tacked on to my bill, which I either failed to notice when I booked the stay or Expedia conveniently failed to advise of. When I asked if I could get credit on my Best Rewards account, I found out that too soured the deal since it was booked through Expedia. Again, something that was not clear on booking the room.
reviews.title: We love the Best Western Lake Buena Vista Resort

reviews.text: But the staff tries very hard to please and the facility itself, while somewhat dated, is very satisfactory.
reviews.title: You're all crazy

reviews.text: In short, my take away is to make certain of the details of the deal before signing up and then go ahead based on real facts. I would stay here again, willingly. Book it through Expedia or another third party--doubtful??
reviews.title: Great trip love the workers

reviews.text: We have stayed here four times now. The rooms are nice and large. All of the rooms have balconies. We enjoy sitting out and seeing the view in the mornings and the evenings. They have great food in the Traders Grill downstairs and it is nice that they have Pizza Hut and a convenience store there also. You can even buy your park tickets at the Disney store in the lobby. All of the waiters and bartenders have been very nice to us. The buses that run to all of the Disney parks are less crowded and easier to travel on than the ones when we have stayed at Disney resorts. Everything was nice and clean. It is a nice walk to Downtown Disney or to the shopping center in the opposite direction. We will definitely come back and stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way!

aka: Best Western Lake Buena Vista Hotel Orlando
description: Located in Downtown Disney®, this Lake Buena Vista hotel is the ideal place to stay for an affordable Disneyworld® vacation. Our hotel near Disneyworld® offers guaranteed admission and continuous complimentary shuttle transportation to all four Walt Disneyworld® theme parks!After a day of non-stop fun and excitement, guests can retire to one of 325 generously-appointed guest rooms each featuring furnished private balconies. Additional business and leisure amenities in each room include 37-inch LG LCD flat panel TV's with cable access, an alarm clock radio with iPod compatibility and complimentary wireless Internet access. Our Lake Buena Vista Resort offers fun for the whole family with an outdoor heated swimming pool, a video game room, fitness center, a cocktail lounge with pool side seating and an on-site restaurant. Business guests staying at the BEST WESTERN Lake Buena Vista Resort Hotel will also appreciate our hotel's business services, meeting facilities and close proximity to local corporations, including Johnson & Johnson, IBM, KPMG and Accenture, in addition to easy access to the Orlando Convention Center. This 100% non-smoking Lake Buena Vista hotel is also situated in the heart of local events like the Disney® Marathon, the Epcot® Food & Wine Festival and the Epcot® Flower & Garden Festival. While you're here, don't forget to visit the ESPN® Wide World of Sports Complex, Downtown Disney® West Side, Downtown Disney® Market Place and Pleasure Island. Just minutes from the BEST WESTERN Lake Buena Vista Resort Hotel, guests will find themselves in the heart of the area's best attractions, including Animal Kingdom®, SeaWorld® Orlando, the Orlando Orange County Convention Center, Discovery Cove Orlando, Universal Studios®, Legoland® Florida and Busch Gardens®.For the ultimate family-friendly Downtown Disney® hotel experience, book a stay today and save with the BEST WESTERN Lake Buena Vista Resort Hotel.
